post.description:
Creates a contact with the provided values.

The values do not have to be unique so it is possible to have multiple contacts with the same name and phone
number. The contacts can be used to transfer an engagement from Glia to any phone number.

site_id.description: A site ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

phone_extension.description:
Phone number extension that is used when calling `phone_number`. A valid extension contains 1-7 digits and any
number of `,` characters.

There is an initial two second delay time before the first extension character is processed. Each `,` character
in the extension adds a two second wait time before the next character is processed. Maximum length is 25
characters.

For operators, this parameter is retrieved from their settings.

id.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of the resource.

site_id.description: A site ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

phone_extension.description:
Phone number extension that is used when calling `phone_number`. A valid extension contains 1-7 digits and any
number of `,` characters.

There is an initial two second delay time before the first extension character is processed. Each `,` character
in the extension adds a two second wait time before the next character is processed. Maximum length is 25
characters.

For operators, this parameter is retrieved from their settings.

created_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was created.

created_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who created the resource.

updated_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was updated.

updated_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who updated the resource.

get.description:
Returns a list of quick contacts.

Unless specified, contacts are returned for all sites that the requesting user has access to.

parameters.name: site_ids[]
parameters.description: Only resources for the specified site IDs will be included in the response. Returns all resources if not specified.

parameters.name: contains
parameters.description:
Only contacts where name, description or phone number contain the specified value, will be included in the
response. All contacts will be returned, when this option is not specified.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies which page is requested. Default value is `1`.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of contacts per page. Minimum value is `1`. Maximum value is `100`. Default value is `30`.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Specifies how the contacts are ordered. Possible values are `asc` or `desc`.
Default value is `asc`.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
Specifies the field by which the contacts are ordered by. Possible values are `name` or `description`. Default
value is `name`.

previous_page.description: URL to the previous page. The value is null when the current page is the first page.

next_page.description: URL to the next page. The value is null when the current page is the last page.

id.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of the resource.

site_id.description: A site ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

phone_extension.description:
Phone number extension that is used when calling `phone_number`. A valid extension contains 1-7 digits and any
number of `,` characters.

There is an initial two second delay time before the first extension character is processed. Each `,` character
in the extension adds a two second wait time before the next character is processed. Maximum length is 25
characters.

For operators, this parameter is retrieved from their settings.

created_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was created.

created_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who created the resource.

updated_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was updated.

updated_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who updated the resource.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: ID of the contact.

id.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of the resource.

site_id.description: A site ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

There is an initial two second delay time before the first extension character is processed. Each `,` character

get.description:
Lists the phone numbers available for purchase. Query string parameters allow you to limit the list of returned
numbers.

Only users with the super manager role can perform this request.

parameters.name: iso_country
parameters.description: Filters available phone numbers by country. The ISO country code format.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description:
Filters available phone numbers by region. The two-letter state or province abbreviation. Only valid when ISO
country is "US" or "CA".

parameters.name: contains
parameters.description:
A pattern on which to match phone numbers. Valid characters are `*` and `[0-9a-zA-Z]`. The `*` character will
match any single digit.

parameters.name: toll_free
parameters.description:
If `true`, lists available toll-free phone numbers. If `false`, lists available local phone numbers. Default
value is `false`.

parameters.name: mms_enabled
parameters.description: Whether the phone numbers can send and receive MMS messages.

capabilities.description: A list of capabilities that the phone number has.

mms.description: Whether the phone number can send and receive MMS messages.

postal_code.description: The postal (zip) code of the phone number. Only defined when the phone number is local.

region.description: The two-letter state or province abbreviation, e.g. "NY". Only defined when the phone number is local.

post.description:
Buys an incoming phone number if the number is available.

Only users with the super manager role can add incoming phone numbers.

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: The incoming phone number.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the incoming phone number.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Short description of the incoming phone number.

parameters.name: site_id
parameters.description: Site ID (in UUID v4 format) of the site the number will belong to.

parameters.name: queue_id
parameters.description:
ID of the queue (in UUID v4 format) to associate with the incoming phone
number.

site_id.description: A site ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

queue_id.description: A queue ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

capabilities.description: A list of capabilities that the phone number has.

mms.description: Whether the phone number can send and receive MMS messages.

created_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was created.

created_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who created the resource.

updated_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was updated.

updated_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who updated the resource.

last_used_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was last used.

forwarding_option.description: Forwarding options for when a call cannot be routed to any operator.

type.description:
One of `phone_number`, `voice_mailbox`, `none`. When `none` then the call is ended when it cannot be routed
to any operator.

voice_mailbox_id.description: Voice mailbox ID (in UUID v4 format).

visitor_context.description: The illustration file which is shown to the Operator during the engagement.

id.description: Illustration asset's ID (in UUID v4 format).

url.description: URL from which the contents of the associated file can be retrieved.

content_type.description: MIME type of the asset's file.

created_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was created.

created_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who created the resource.

url.description: URL from which the contents of the associated file can be retrieved.

content_type.description: MIME type of the asset's file.

created_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was created.

created_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who created the resource.

in_queue_audio.description: The audio file which is played while the visitor is waiting in the queue.

url.description: URL from which the contents of the associated file can be retrieved.

The audio file which is played when a visitor is bounced from the queue due to normal or abnormal system's
behavior.

id.description: Audio asset's ID (in UUID v4 format).

created_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who created the resource.

The user whose bearer access token is used in `Authorization` must have the role super manager.

delete.description:
Removes the given incoming phone number from the bought numbers list.

The incoming phone numbers are recycled. Make sure the number is not used before removing it.

Only users with the role super manager can delete incoming phone numbers.

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: The incoming phone number.

post.description:
Creates a SIP domain with the provided values.

SIP domains can be used to receive audio via the SIP protocol.

site_id.description: A site ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

domain.description:
The domain part of the SIP URI. For example, in case of a SIP URI `sip:123@example.com`, we consider everything
after `@` as part of the domain. This can either be a domain name (`example.com`) or an IP address
with port (`172.16.254.1:8080`).
Maximum length is 220 characters and an [RFC3261](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3261#section-25.1) compliant
format is supported.

webhooks.description:
A list of webhooks that will subscribe to SIP domain events. A maximum of 10 webhooks are allowed. Currently,
only `sip_domain.delete` event is available.

id.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of the resource.

site_id.description: A site ID (in UUID v4 format) associated with the resource.

domain.description:
The domain part of the SIP URI. For example, in case of a SIP URI `sip:123@example.com`, we consider everything
after `@` as part of the domain. This can either be a domain name (`example.com`) or an IP address
with port (`172.16.254.1:8080`).
Maximum length is 220 characters and an [RFC3261](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3261#section-25.1) compliant
format is supported.

created_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was created.

created_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who created the resource.

updated_at.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp of when the resource was updated.

updated_by.description: A user ID (in UUID v4 format) of who updated the resource.

If the site IDs are not specified, returns the SIP domains for all the user's sites.

post.description:

The user whose bearer access token is used in `Authorization` must have the role super manager on the site where
the voice mailbox is created.

The user whose bearer access token is used in `Authorization` must have the role super manager on the requested
site. By default, voice mailboxes for all user's sites are returned.

delete.description:
Deletes a certain voice mailbox.

The voice mailbox cannot be deleted if an incoming phone number has set it as a forwarding option. The error with
status code `409 - Conflict` is returned in this case.

Only the user with the role super manager can delete a voice mailbox.

parameters.name: voice_mailbox_id
parameters.description: ID of the voice mailbox.

get.description:
Downloads a voicemail.

When used with `Accept: audio/mpeg` header, the endpoint will perform an HTTP redirect to the voicemail audio
recording file.

Ensure that your HTTP client strips the `Authorization` header when following a redirect, i.e when using
_cURL_, ensure that your version is not affected by a [bug in its redirect implementation](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2018-1000007.html).

parameters.name: voice_mailbox_id
parameters.description: ID of the voice mailbox.

parameters.name: voicemail_id
parameters.description: ID of the voicemail.

post.description:
Sends an SMS.

The user making the request must have super manager role.

* When a message has been sent out, a proactive engagement request is created.
* Outbound SMS has a rate limit of 1 request per second per site.
* Make sure you are familiar with the forbidden topics before using Outbound SMS service, see our knowledge base for [Forbidden Topics in Outbound SMS](https://support.glia.com/en_US/security-compliance/forbidden-topics-in-outbound-sms).

### Configuring Twilio Messaging Service
When sending the outbound SMS from the Twilio Messaging Service, the Messaging Service should have the incoming message webhook configured beforehand. The webhook is needed for Glia to receive the responses to the outbound SMS messages and enqueue the responses in the appropriate Glia queues. The webhook URL should point to `https://api.glia.com/omnicall/twilio/sms` and contain the following query parameters:

* `queue_id` - The ID of the Glia queue, where the responses will be enqueued.
* `context_id` - (Optional) The ID of the context shown to the operator when an engagement is created from the queued response.

Example URL: `https://api.glia.com/omnicall/twilio/sms?queue_id=f58d4671-e888-4e87-96dc-1d41027bebc5&context_id=abc34343-e888-5fe4-98a1-55a786e9f234`

from_number.description:
Phone number that the SMS is sent from. Note that this number must be assigned to a site first.

The user making the request must have access to the site that the phone number is assigned to.

to_number.description: Phone number that the SMS is sent to.

message.description: Content of the SMS. An empty message is treated as if no message was given.
message.example: A message that will be sent to the recipient

webhooks.description:
See [Webhooks](https://docs.glia.com/glia-dev/reference/webhooks) section for more information.
An empty array of webhooks is treated as if no webhooks were specified.

* When SMS delivery fails: `engagement.request.failure` event is fired.
* When SMS has been delivered: `engagement.request.deliver` is fired.

url.description: The URL (including protocol) to which the HTTP request will be sent to.

method.description: The HTTP method that will be used for the HTTP request.

headers.description:
An arbitrary object which will be used to set request headers for the HTTP request. The keys of the object
will be used as header names and values as header values. This can be used to authenticate incoming HTTP
requests in your server.

events.description: An array of events (at least one) upon which a HTTP request will be made.

oneOf.title: Send SMS with Twilio Messaging Service

service_id.description: ID of the Twilio Messaging Service that the SMS is sent with.

site_id.description:
ID of a site that is associated with the Twilio account where the Messaging Service is defined.

The user making the request must have access to the specified site.

to_number.description: Phone number that the SMS is sent to.

message.description: Content of the SMS. An empty message is treated as if no message was given.
message.example: A message that will be sent to the recipient

webhooks.description:
See [Webhooks](https://docs.glia.com/glia-dev/reference/webhooks) section for more information.
An empty array of webhooks is treated as if no webhooks were specified.

* When SMS delivery fails: `engagement.request.failure` event is fired.
* When SMS has been delivered: `engagement.request.deliver` is fired.

url.description: The URL (including protocol) to which the HTTP request will be sent to.

method.description: The HTTP method that will be used for the HTTP request.

headers.description:
An arbitrary object which will be used to set request headers for the HTTP request. The keys of the object
will be used as header names and values as header values. This can be used to authenticate incoming HTTP
requests in your server.

events.description: An array of events (at least one) upon which a HTTP request will be made.

200.description: SMS is being sent. Returns the engagement request ID for this message.

engagement_request_id.description: ID of the engagement request for this message.

401.description: Your bearer token has expired or you are not authorized to perform this request.

403.description: Your bearer token is valid but you have no access to the requested resource.

409.description: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the requested resource.

422.description: Request is invalid. This occurs when some of the required fields are missing or invalid.

post.description:
Sends multiple SMS messages in bulk.

The user making the request must have super manager role.

* On Glia's side the messages will be temporarily cached and a proactive engagement request is created for each one.
* On the Glia's telephony provider's side, the actual SMS sending rate will depend on the type of number you are using and your Twilio Messaging Service configuration. For default rates, see our knowledge base: [SMS Rate Limits and Message Queues](https://support.glia.com/en_US/technical-requirements/sms-rate-limits-and-message-queues).
* Make sure you are familiar with the forbidden topics before using Outbound SMS service, see our knowledge base for [Forbidden Topics in Outbound SMS](https://support.glia.com/en_US/security-compliance/forbidden-topics-in-outbound-sms).

### Usage
* A personal `message` can be used for every `to` recipient. If the personal `message` is not specified, the default `message` is used instead. An error is returned if neither is found.
* The `webhooks` are specified in a similar way to `message` for every `to` recipient. If no personal or default `webhooks` is specified, then no webhooks will be triggered for the message. Use a unique webhook URL for each message to distinguish the result of one message from another.

### Configuring Twilio Messaging Service
When sending the outbound SMS from the Twilio Messaging Service, the Messaging Service should have the incoming message webhook configured beforehand. The webhook is needed for Glia to receive the responses to the outbound SMS messages and enqueue the responses in the appropriate Glia queues. The webhook URL should point to `https://api.glia.com/omnicall/twilio/sms` and contain the following query parameters:

* `queue_id` - The ID of the Glia queue, where the responses will be enqueued.
* `context_id` - (Optional) The ID of the context shown to the operator when an engagement is created from the queued response.

Example URL: `https://api.glia.com/omnicall/twilio/sms?queue_id=f58d4671-e888-4e87-96dc-1d41027bebc5&context_id=abc34343-e888-5fe4-98a1-55a786e9f234`

service_id.description: ID of the Twilio Messaging Service that the SMS is sent with.

site_id.description:
ID of a site that is associated with the Twilio account where the Messaging Service is defined.

The user making the request must have access to the specified site.

message.description: Content of the default SMS message.
message.example: A default message that will be sent to the recipients

webhooks.description:
See [Webhooks](https://docs.glia.com/glia-dev/reference/webhooks) section for more information.
An empty array of webhooks is treated as if no webhooks were specified.

* When SMS delivery fails: `engagement.request.failure` event is fired.
* When SMS has been delivered: `engagement.request.deliver` is fired.

url.description: The URL (including protocol) to which the HTTP request will be sent to.

method.description: The HTTP method that will be used for the HTTP request.

headers.description:
An arbitrary object which will be used to set request headers for the HTTP request. The keys of the object
will be used as header names and values as header values. This can be used to authenticate incoming HTTP
requests in your server.

events.description: An array of events (at least one) upon which a HTTP request will be made.

to.description:
An array of message recipients.

At least one recipient has to be specified. The maximum number of recipients is `1000`.

to_number.description: Phone number that the SMS is sent to.

message.description: Content of the SMS. An empty message is treated as if no message was given.
message.example: A message that will be sent to the recipient

webhooks.description:
See [Webhooks](https://docs.glia.com/glia-dev/reference/webhooks) section for more information.
An empty array of webhooks is treated as if no webhooks were specified.

* When SMS delivery fails: `engagement.request.failure` event is fired.
* When SMS has been delivered: `engagement.request.deliver` is fired.

url.description: The URL (including protocol) to which the HTTP request will be sent to.

method.description: The HTTP method that will be used for the HTTP request.

headers.description:
An arbitrary object which will be used to set request headers for the HTTP request. The keys of the object
will be used as header names and values as header values. This can be used to authenticate incoming HTTP
requests in your server.

events.description: An array of events (at least one) upon which a HTTP request will be made.

example.message: Personal message overrides the default message.
Personal webhooks override the default webhooks.

204.description: SMS messages have been temporarily cached in Glia and will be sent at the first opportunity.

401.description: Your bearer token has expired or you are not authorized to perform this request.
